newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Centennial says share suspension unfair.
newsitem.headline: Centennial says share suspension unfair.

text.p: Centennial City Inc said on Wednesday that a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) order suspending trading in its shares was unjustified.
The suspension would prejudice the investing public and cause panic to both domestic and foreign investors, a Centennial statement said.
The SEC ordered on Wednesday the suspension of trading in Centennial shares for possible violation of full-disclosure rules in connection with a reclamation project being undertaken along Manila Bay.
The award of the project to the Amari consortium, of which Centennial is a part, was questioned by a Senator saying the government had got a lower price.
Centennial holds 20 percent in the Amari consortium. Thai construction firm Italian-Thai Public Development Plc is one of the partners in the waterfront development.
The SEC said Centennial had not disclosed certain material information regarding the company, including the existence of other apppraisal reports bearing different valuations on the Amari properties.

The SEC said it has set a hearing with Centennial City on Friday for the company to prove why it should not be sanctioned, which may include the revocation of an approval to increase its capital stock. -- Manila newsroom (632) 841-8937
